isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: BENDIX TU-FLO 550 AND TU-FLO 750 - DISASSEMBLE - COMPRESSOR CRANKCASE

step1.para: Remove the key or keys (Item 30) from the crankshaft (Item 29) and any burrs from the crankshaft where the key or keys were removed.

note.para: Through drive compressors may have a crankshaft key at both ends.

step1.para: Remove the four capscrews (Item 35) and lockwashers or nuts and lockwashers that secure the rear end cover (Item 34) to the crankcase.
Remove the rear end cover (Item 34), thrust washer (Item 31) and end cover oil seal ring (Item 33), taking care not to damage the bearing if present in the end cover.
If the compressor has ball type main bearings, press the crankshaft (Item 29) and ball bearings from the crankcase, then press the ball bearings from the crankshaft.
Press the oil seal out of the compressor crankcase, if so equipped.
